question: 主に
sourceMnemonic: <ja>主</ja> means <kanji>main</kanji> so when you add <ja>に</ja> it becomes the adverb <vocabulary>mainly</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You <vocabulary>mainly</vocabulary> spend your time talking to your master Moe. But you mainly address him like, "<reading>Oh Moe</reading> The Great!" (<ja>おも</ja>). That's because he's above you. Imagine yourself saying "OH MOE THE GREAT!" as you walk into his room, bowing low.
